title: Sling
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Name                                           | Sling                                              |
| :--------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| Skill                                          | [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons") |
| [Damage](/Weapon_damage "Weapon damage")       | 7                                                  |
| Accuracy                                       | +0                                                 |
| [Base delay](/Weapon_speed "Weapon speed") (%) | 14                                                 |
| [Min delay](/Minimum_delay "Minimum delay")    | 7 at skill 14                                      |
| [Hands](/Handedness "Handedness")              | 1H                                                 |
| Size                                           | Little                                             |
| Ranged?                                        | Yes                                                |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A piece of cloth and leather for launching stones, adequate for hunting small game like rabbits or goblins.***"And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sank into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth."-KJV Bible, 1 Samuel 17:49. |

> This weapon falls into the 'Ranged Weapons' category. It is a one-handed weapon.

**Slings** are one-handed [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons"). They are the lightest ranged weapon, and much more common than the other ranged one-hander, [hand crossbows](/Hand_crossbow "Hand crossbow").

## Strategy

Generally, a D:1 character with a sling is stronger than the same character without one. Slings let you attack from range for 0 MP, which is nice for both melee and mage starts. You don't need to train Ranged Weapons to benefit from one. Even at 0 skill, firing a sling at a melee enemy will net some extra damage (enough to outright kill D:1 enemies). Past [Lair](/Lair "Lair") or so, the damage from an untrained sling is too low to bother with.

Compared to other ranged options, slings are the weakest [ranged weapon](/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon"). They are stronger than [stones](/Stone "Stone") and slightly stronger than [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang") at 0 skill (though boomerangs scale better with skill). [Shortbows](/Shortbow "Shortbow") offer +1 base damage and more accuracy, but you can't wield a shield with one.

|                          | Image                                                                  |
| ------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Mundane**              | [![Sling 1.png](/images/4/41/Sling_1.png)](/File:Sling_1.png)          |
| **Magical**              | [![Sling 2.png](/images/4/4e/Sling_2.png)](/File:Sling_2.png)          |
| **Artifact**             | [![Sling 3.png](/images/5/57/Sling_3.png)](/File:Sling_3.png)          |
|                          | [Unrandart](/Unrandart "Unrandart")                                    |
| **[Punk](/Punk "Punk")** | [![Urand punk.png](/images/e/ec/Urand_punk.png)](/File:Urand_punk.png) |

## History

- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), hunting slings were renamed back into slings, with the removal of the [Slings skill](/Slings_\(skill\) "Slings (skill)") and [fustibali](/Fustibali "Fustibali"). They now use Ranged Weapons skill. Also, prior to this version:

  - Hunting slings required use of [stones](/Stone "Stone") or [sling bullets](/Sling_bullet "Sling bullet"), which added 2 or 4 damage to your shots.
  - They had an accuracy of +2 and a base delay of 12 (mindelay of 6).
  - Their damage did not scale with [DEX](/DEX "DEX") and their attack speed wasn't slowed down by [armour encumbrance](/Encumbrance_rating "Encumbrance rating"), like all ranged weapons.

- In [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), slings were renamed into [hunting slings](/Hunting_sling "Hunting sling"), with the addition of [greatslings](/Greatsling "Greatsling") (fustibali). Ranged combat also worked differently; they had 0 base damage, which was improved by their ammo.

| [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")            | [Demon blade](/Demon_blade "Demon blade") • [Double sword](/Double_sword "Double sword") • [Eudemon blade](/Eudemon_blade "Eudemon blade") • [Falchion](/Falchion "Falchion") • [Great sword](/Great_sword "Great sword") • [Long sword](/Long_sword "Long sword") • [Scimitar](/Scimitar "Scimitar") • [Triple sword](/Triple_sword "Triple sword")                                                                                                                                                     |
| [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")                     | [Bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche") • [Demon trident](/Demon_trident "Demon trident") • [Glaive](/Glaive "Glaive") • [Halberd](/Halberd "Halberd") ([Scythe](/Scythe "Scythe")) • [Spear](/Spear "Spear") • [Trident](/Trident "Trident") • [Trishula](/Trishula "Trishula")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

| [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")                     | [Boomerang](/Boomerang "Boomerang") • [Dart](/Dart "Dart") • [Javelin](/Javelin "Javelin") • [Large rock](/Large_rock "Large rock") • [Stone](/Stone "Stone") • [Throwing net](/Throwing_net "Throwing net")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
html:
Sling

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Name Sling
Skill Ranged Weapons
Damage 7
Accuracy +0
Base delay (%) 14
Min delay 7 at skill 14
Hands 1H
Size Little
Ranged? Yes
A piece of cloth and leather for launching stones, adequate for hunting small game like rabbits or goblins.

"And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sank into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth."

-KJV Bible, 1 Samuel 17:49.

This weapon falls into the 'Ranged Weapons' category. It is a one-handed weapon.

Slings are one-handed Ranged Weapons. They are the lightest ranged weapon, and much more common than the other ranged one-hander, hand crossbows.

Strategy

Generally, a D:1 character with a sling is stronger than the same character without one. Slings let you attack from range for 0 MP, which is nice for both melee and mage starts. You don't need to train Ranged Weapons to benefit from one. Even at 0 skill, firing a sling at a melee enemy will net some extra damage (enough to outright kill D:1 enemies). Past Lair or so, the damage from an untrained sling is too low to bother with.

Compared to other ranged options, slings are the weakest ranged weapon. They are stronger than stones and slightly stronger than boomerangs at 0 skill (though boomerangs scale better with skill). Shortbows offer +1 base damage and more accuracy, but you can't wield a shield with one.

Image
Mundane
Magical
Artifact
Unrandart
Punk

History

  • In 0.29, hunting slings were renamed back into slings, with the removal of the Slings skill and fustibali. They now use Ranged Weapons skill. Also, prior to this version:
    • Hunting slings required use of stones or sling bullets, which added 2 or 4 damage to your shots.
    • They had an accuracy of +2 and a base delay of 12 (mindelay of 6).
    • Their damage did not scale with DEX and their attack speed wasn't slowed down by armour encumbrance, like all ranged weapons.
  • In 0.15, slings were renamed into hunting slings, with the addition of greatslings (fustibali). Ranged combat also worked differently; they had 0 base damage, which was improved by their ammo.

Polearms Bardiche • Demon trident • Glaive • Halberd (Scythe) • Spear • Trident • Trishula
Ranged Weapons Arbalest • Hand cannon • Longbow • Orcbow • Shortbow • Sling • Triple crossbow

{{crawlquote|This weapon falls into the 'Ranged Weapons' category. It is a one-handed weapon.}}

'''Slings''' are one-handed [[Ranged Weapons]]. They are the lightest ranged weapon, and much more common than the other ranged one-hander, [[hand crossbow]]s.

==Strategy==
Generally, a D:1 character with a sling is stronger than the same character without one. Slings let you attack from range for 0 MP, which is nice for both melee and mage starts. You don't need to train Ranged Weapons to benefit from one. Even at 0 skill, firing a sling at a melee enemy will net some extra damage (enough to outright kill D:1 enemies). Past [[Lair]] or so, the damage from an untrained sling is too low to bother with.

Compared to other ranged options, slings are the weakest [[ranged weapon]]. They are stronger than [[stone]]s and slightly stronger than [[boomerang]]s at 0 skill (though boomerangs scale better with skill). [[Shortbow]]s offer +1 base damage and more accuracy, but you can't wield a shield with one.

==History==
*In [[0.29]], hunting slings were renamed back into slings, with the removal of the [[Slings (skill)|Slings skill]] and [[fustibali]]. They now use Ranged Weapons skill. Also, prior to this version:
**Hunting slings required use of [[stone]]s or [[sling bullet]]s, which added 2 or 4 damage to your shots.
**They had an accuracy of +2 and a base delay of 12 (mindelay of 6).
**Their damage did not scale with [[DEX]] and their attack speed wasn't slowed down by [[encumbrance rating|armour encumbrance]], like all ranged weapons.
*In [[0.15]], slings were renamed into [[hunting sling]]s, with the addition of [[greatsling]]s (fustibali). Ranged combat also worked differently; they had 0 base damage, which was improved by their ammo.
